thread.title: Flash not worried by bullet in his leg
thread.title_full: Flash not worried by bullet in his leg

author: Jay Boreham
title: Flash not worried by bullet in his leg
text:
Flash not worried by bullet in his leg JAY BOREHAM Last updated 07:28, February 24 2017 JAY BOREHAM/FAIRFAX NZ 
"I'm absolutely heartbroken and disgusted that a human being could be so incredibly foul and cold-hearted, Flash's owner said. 
A bullet to the leg barely fazed Flash the cat, but its discovery has disturbed and outraged his owner. 
The long-haired tabby from Stanmore Bay in north Auckland came home limping two weeks ago, but two days later seemed fine, Flash's mum Sam Scott said. 
"He never told us, it didn't seem to annoy him," the Brian Cres resident said. 
The piece of metal remained unnoticed until a probably unrelated trauma injury saw Flash taken to the Whangaparaoa Veterinary Clinic on Tuesday. 
He had large swelling and bruising on his abdomen and during a routine radiograph to ensure no other injuries, staff spotted a bullet-shaped object right on the edge of an X-ray, veterinarian Dr Erin Cassie said. 
"So we took another view to identify exactly what it was". 
They found a bullet lodged behind the knee on his rear left leg. 
An inspection of the leg revealed an injury about two weeks old. 
"It hasn't hit the bone so there is no kind of major damage done by it and the body will just close around it. 
"It will probably sit there for the rest of his life," Cassie said. 
The vet said she couldn't speculate whether Flash's second injury involved sinister motives. 
"He could have been getting into general cat mischief. 
"I do think it's shocking to think that people would shoot at someone's beloved pet," she said. 
Flash would return to the vets in two weeks for a follow-up, but Scott said her fur baby was otherwise healthy and happy and hadn't been affected by the gunshot. 
But she was appalled someone was shooting at animals in her neighbourhood. 
"Flash is actually really friendly. I don't see why anyone would want to harm him. 
"I'm absolutely heartbroken and disgusted that a human being could be so incredibly foul and cold-hearted." 
Scott was now warning pet owners on Brian Cres or nearby to be aware someone was taking potshots at animals in the area, and hoped karma would catch up with the shooter. - Stuff
